recipe.name: Chelsea Buns
recipe.description: Chelsea Buns are a traditional British sweet roll made from an enriched yeast dough filled with a mixture of dried fruits, brown sugar, and cinnamon, then rolled, sliced, baked, and glazed to perfection.
steps: Sift the flour and salt into a large bowl.
Make a well in the middle and add the yeast.
Warm the milk and butter in a saucepan until the butter melts and the mixture is lukewarm.
Add the milk mixture and egg to the flour mixture and stir until the contents come together as a soft dough. Add extra flour if needed.
Tip the dough onto a floured surface and knead for five minutes until smooth and elastic.
Lightly oil a bowl, place the dough in it, cover with cling film, and set aside in a warm place for one hour, or until doubled in size.
For the filling, knock the dough back to its original size and turn out onto a floured surface.
Roll the dough into a rectangle 0.5cm thick.
Brush with melted butter, then sprinkle over the brown sugar, cinnamon, and dried fruit.
Roll the dough into a tight cylinder, cut into ten 4cm slices, and place them onto the prepared baking sheet, leaving space between each slice.
Cover with a tea towel and set aside to rise for 30 minutes.
Bake the buns in the oven for 20-25 minutes, or until risen and golden-brown.
Meanwhile, for the glaze, heat the milk and sugar in a saucepan until boiling. Reduce the heat and simmer for 2-3 minutes.
Remove the buns from the oven and brush with the glaze, then set aside to cool on a wire rack.
Your creation is complete—now let the flavors shine!
